sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Which of the following is not involved with the movement of water from the soil to the leaves of plants?
Water vapour from the air spaces in a plant's leaf passes out through the stomata by the physical process of
Transpiration is
selectableOptions: the rise of water up the stem of a plant.
the excretion of excess water produced in photosynthesis.
the loss of water vapour from the leaves of a plant.
questions.wordAnswer: the loss of water vapour from the leaves of a plant.

questions.question: Which one of the following is most likely to increase the rate of transpiration from the leaves of a potted plant?
selectableOptions: Putting it outside in the rain.
Putting it into a cold room.
Putting grease on the lower surfaces of the leaves.
Putting it in the moving air from a fan.
questions.wordAnswer: Putting it in the moving air from a fan.

questions.question: The tissue responsible for the transport of carbohydrate in a plant is known as
Which structure is responsible for much water loss by transpiration?
Which of the following structures regulate the opening and closing of stomata in plants?

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: When the leaves of a potted plant are exposed to radioactive carbon dioxide during the day, which tissue will become radioactive first?
Which of the following is not an adaption of the leaf to reduce water loss by transpiration?
selectableOptions: Presence of hairy structures on the lower surface

questions.question: Which of the following environmental conditions will cause rapid transpiration?
selectableOptions: High humidity, bright light, low temperature.
High humidity, dim light, high temperature.
Low humidity, bright light, high temperature.
Low humidity, dim light, low temperature.
questions.wordAnswer: Low humidity, bright light, high temperature.

questions.question: Water is raised from the xylem of the roots to the leaves of a tree mainly by
A potted plant was left in hot sun for 6 hours. After 6 hours, the plant withered because
selectableOptions: more water was lost by transpiration than was absorbed.
the amount of water in te cell increased.
the xylem could not provide enough support.
questions.wordAnswer: more water was lost by transpiration than was absorbed.

questions.question: Which of the following is the main force responsible for the movement of water in the xylem of plants?
Which structure in a green plant transports water and mineral salts?
Root hairs of a plant absorb mineral salts from the soil by
The Loss of water through the stomata of leaves to the atmosphere as water vapour is called
In which order does water molecules transported from the stem, pass through into the air surrounding the leaf?
selectableOptions: Spongy mesophyll cell -> airspace -> stomata -> xylem vessel
Spongy mesophyll cell -> airspace -> xylem vessel -> stomata
Xylem vessel -> spongy mesophyll cell -> airspace -> stomata
Xylem vessel -> stomata -> airspace -> spongy mesophyll
questions.wordAnswer: Xylem vessel -> spongy mesophyll cell -> airspace -> stomata

questions.question: In an experiment, a ring around the bark of a tree was removed. This will result in
selectableOptions: Lack of water in the leaves
Lack of mineral salts in the leaves
The swelling of the bark on the upper side where the ring was removed
questions.wordAnswer: The swelling of the bark on the upper side where the ring was removed

questions.question: In a potometer experiment to measure the rate of absorption of water by a leafy shoot, the shoot was cut under water to
selectableOptions: ensure that water enters the xylem
ensure that no air bubbles enter the xylem
ensure that no dust particles enter the xylem
ensure that water does not leave the xylem
questions.wordAnswer: ensure that no air bubbles enter the xylem

questions.question: Which of the following is generated as a result of continuous absorption of water from the soil by roots?

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: The vascular bundle is made up of
The forces involved in the upward movement of water in the xylem vessel are
Xylem vessels
Absorption of mineral salts by plants is due to
Its destruction will prevent the flow of carbohydrates produced during photosynthesis to the roots.

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are true and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are true and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is true and the second statement is false. 
D. If the first statement is false and the second statement is true.

twoStatements: All water taken up by a leafy shoot is transpired.
A potometer is used to measure the rate of water uptake by a leafy shoot
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Mineral salts are moved through plants dissolved in water in the xylem vessels.
Plants absorb mineral salts from the salt by active transport.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: The lower surface of a dicot leaf transpires more than the upper surface.
There are more stomata on the lower surface than on the upper surface.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: The rate of transpiration is higher on a windy day.
When the air surrounding the leaves of a plant is in motion, it is carried away before it can become saturated.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: The ability of water to rise up in thin vessels e.g xylem
Root hair cells accumulate salts from the surrounding soil even though the concentration of inorganic salts is usually greater in the root hair cells than in the external solution.
Transportation of soluble products of photosynthesis from leaves to underground storage organs
Water molecules in roots are linked to those in the leaves because water molecules stick to each other and the walls of the vessels.
Movement of sucrose and amino acids inside phloem vessels.
Carries out selective control of materials entering or leaving a plant cell.
Loss of water vapour by plants through stomata
Loss of water by plants in droplet form
Its destruction will interrupt movement of water in plants
Occurs when a plant loses more water than it can absorb from the soil

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: In a potometer experiment, a plant's shoot should be cut under water. This precaution is to ensure that
selectableOptions: the whole apparatus is kept moist and cool.
air does not enter the xylem vessels.
any leak in the apparatus is easily detected.
questions.wordAnswer: air does not enter the xylem vessels.

questions.question:
An experiment was carried out to find out the tissue responsible for transporting food substances downwards from the leaves. 
In this experiment, the bark of the stem of a potted plant was removed, leaving the xylem undamaged. 
What is the aim of this experiment?
selectableOptions: To demonstrate that water is transported by xylem tissue from the roots to the leaves.
To demonstrate that food substances are transported by phloem tissue downwards from the leaves.
To demonstrate that cambium is necessary for the formation of cork.
To demonstrate that xylem tissue transports water and food substances.
questions.wordAnswer: To demonstrate that food substances are transported by phloem tissue downwards from the leaves.

questions.question:
An experiment was carried out to find out the tissue responsible for transporting food substances downwards from the leaves. 
In this experiment, the bark of the stem of a potted plant was removed, leaving the xylem undamaged. 
What name is given to this experiment?

An experiment was carried out to find out the tissue responsible for transporting food substances downwards from the leaves. 
In this experiment, the bark of the stem of a potted plant was removed, leaving the xylem undamaged. 
A few months later, the area of the stem immediately above the ringed portion will become swollen due to

An experiment was carried out to find out the tissue responsible for transporting food substances downwards from the leaves. 
In this experiment, the bark of the stem of a potted plant was removed, leaving the xylem undamaged. 
A few months later, the potted plant died because
selectableOptions: the leaves became short of water.
the roots became short of food.
questions.wordAnswer: the roots became short of food.

questions.question: Which of the following will least affect the rate of transpiration?
selectableOptions: Greasing the upper surfaces of the leaves.
Greasing both surfaces of the leaves.
Greasing the lower surfaces of the leaves.
questions.wordAnswer: Greasing the upper surfaces of the leaves.

questions.question: The diagram below illustrates an experimental setup. The part labeled 1 is
The diagram below illustrates an experimental setup. The function of the part labeled 2 is to
selectableOptions: prevent the entry of insects into the soil.
prevent the entry of light into the soil.
prevent light from shining on the delicate root.
prevent evaporation of water from the soil.
questions.wordAnswer: prevent evaporation of water from the soil.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used to detect the loss of water vapour from the leaves of plants?
A seedling transplanted on a hot, windy day withers because
selectableOptions: the seedling loses more water than it can absorb from the soil.
the wind carries the water faster.
the roots have not adequately penetrated the soil.
questions.wordAnswer: the seedling loses more water than it can absorb from the soil.
